sections.MISSION:
with Range Control, and coordination with Dakota TRP.
Phase 2: Movement. This Phase begins with Comanche TRP SP to Range 211 and ends with TRP CP established. Key to this phase is using allotted route, establishment of the TAA, and Range Control coordination.
Phase 3:
sections.PURPOSE: of this event is to certify all Teams during LFX conditions and set conditions for PLT-level
sections.TASKS:
. Decisive to this event is the completion of dry and blank fire. This is decisive because it will ensure Teams are prepared to advance to the live fire iteration. We assume tactical risk by using live ammunition. We will mitigate this risk through planning, rehearsals, range safeties, and proper wear of PPE.
Training Objectives Set up DMR Weapon System
Engage targets at distances ranging out to 1000 meters
React to Direct Fire Contact While Dismounted (07-SQD-D9501)
sections.END STATE: Teams effectively plan and rehearse. Teams employ direct fire control principles and are prepared to execute collective training at higher echelons.
sections.EXECUTION:
. This phase begins with TRP CP established and ends with the Comanche TRP RTB. Key to this phase is the validation of SOPs and Team RXLs, certification of Team LFXs, communication between elements, and AARs.
Phase 4: Reconsolidation. This phase begins with the SP of C TRP and ends when all MWE is accounted for in TRP AO. Key to this phase is CL V dunnage, accountability of MWE, and initiating recovery. ​

Movement to Contact
N
Sequence
Notional Flank suppression of objective. Team Leader receives lift fire confirmation from Safety.
Team SPs across LD (FOOM: fire team wedge, bounding overwatch). Northeastern Avenue of Approach.
3x ENY targets appear when Team reaches PL RED. Fire Team engages.
Fire Team clears through targets and maneuvers on building along DOA 1. Fire Team stacks on the right side of building.
